etymologies: late 19th century. From the name of W. A. Roebling, U.S. civil engineer + -ite

definitions: A rare mineral found as an alteration product of lead ore and typically occurring as compact white masses of minute crystals.

notes.text: Roeblingite is a sulphate, silicate, and hydroxide of lead, calcium, and manganese, Pb₂Ca₆Mn(Si₆O₁₈)(SO₄)₂(OH)₂·4H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic.
